text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus subhinoidea is an uncommon Asian species of trees in the beech family. It has been found only on the Island of Hainan in southern China.Quercus subhinoidea is a tree up to 13 meters tall. Twigs are covered with yellow-brown hairs. Leaves can be as much as 12 cm long.
text.External links: line drawing, Flora of China Illustrations vol. 4, fig. 391, drawings 1-2 at upper left
